Celebrating 30 Years of AIDS Vancouver

The 30 30 campaign was created in 2013 to celebrate AIDS Vancouverâ€™s 30th anniversary. The campaign pieces together the dynamic history of HIV in Vancouver, told by and for those who where there.

1991

1992

A tristique penatibus urna ridiculus placerat dapibus.

In 1992

  • First website is launched. LINK
  • Riots in LA after police officers let off for the beating of Rodney King. LINK
  • Bill Clinton wins US presdiential election. LINK

Local

  • Dr. Peter Jepson-Young passes away shortly after establishing the Dr. Peter AIDS Foundation. LINK
  • BC Centre for Excellence in HIV/AIDS begins operations at St.Paul's, mandate to treat, research and educate. LINK
  • PARC AV and Vancouver PWAs Society join under one umbrella society Pacific AIDS Resource Centre.
  • Prison Outreach program established at PWA Society. LINK

Statistics

  • 9,563 calls to AIDS Vanocuver's Helpline.
  • 327 Reported New AIDS Cases in BC LINK
  • 3.3 million worldwide AIDS deaths. LINK

Global

  • FDA introduces 10 min. test that detects HIV-1. LINK
  • International Community for Women Living with HIV/AIDS founded. LINK
  • The 8th International AIDS Conference scheduled to be held in Boston moved to Amsterdam, due to U.S. entry restrictions on people living with HIV/AIDS. LINK

National

  • Canadian HIV/AIDS Legal Network established. LINK
  • The establishment of the CTNâ€™s Postdoctoral Fellowship Program. LINK
  • CAS and its partners launch AIDS Treatment Information System. LINK

AIDS Vancouver - Prevent. Act. Support.

AIDS Vancouver plays a special role in providing quality health care to people affected by HIV/AIDS living in the Lower Mainland. It is clearly more than just a community health care organization. It is an organization whose presence and continued strength is essential to the quality for life of this community and of each individual and family who draws on its services. Our Agency is a vital community asset which everyone affected by HIV/AIDS can share, and in which we all have a stake.

Visit us at aidsvancouver.org

2013 © AIDS Vancouver
